title: Limbella fryei
text:
Limbella fryei, or Frye's limbella moss, is a species of <a href="moss">moss</a> in the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Amblystegiaceae">Amblystegiaceae</a>. It is <a href="Endemism">endemic</a> to the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It is believed to occur in <a href="Oregon">Oregon</a>.
As the species is threatened by <a href="habitat%20loss">habitat loss</a> while only occurring in a very restricted area (less than 10 km2), it has been classified as <a href="critically%20endangered">critically endangered</a> by the <a href="IUCN">IUCN</a>.
References.
<a href="http%3A//www.fs.fed.us/r6/sfpnw/issssp/documents/planning-docs/sfs-br-limbella-fryei-2010-05.pdf">USDA Forest Service Species Fact Sheet</a>
